G. 1, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:25:9" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 25, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aedui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppidum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 4, 4, § 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">provincia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:17" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 17</bibl></cit>: vectigal, i. e. <hi rend="ital">a fixed yearly impost</hi> or <hi rend="ital">contribution in money</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:6:section=12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 6, § 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 2:21" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 2, 21</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">stī^pen-dĭārĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">tributaries</hi> (in money; <cit><quote lang="la">whereas vectigales in kind): socii stipendiariique populi Romani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 3, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:9:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 9, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:18:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 3, 18, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 10</bibl>; (opp. vectigales) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:60:section=134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 60, § 134</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 5, 10</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:55" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 55</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.—Sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vectigalis stipendiariusque et servus populi Romani (Hannibal),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:41:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 41, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45424.1" n="II" level="1"> In milit. lang., <hi rend="ital">receiving pay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">serving for pay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stipendiary</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Romani) postquam stipendiarii facti sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 8, 3</bibl></cit>: cohortes, Auct. B. Afr. 43.</sense></entryFree>
stipendior: <entryFree id="n45425" type="main" key="sti_pendi^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stīpendĭor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n45425.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">to receive pay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to serve for pay</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">regi eorum peditum sexcenta M. stipendiantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 19, 22, § 68</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: (infantes Pontici) butyro stipendiati, <hi rend="ital">serving for butter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">getting butter for pay</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">for their maintenance</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 3, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stipendiosus: <entryFree id="n45426" type="hapax" key="sti_pendi^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stīpendĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n45426.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">belonging to military service</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">milites (opp. tirones),</quote> <trans><tr>soldiers in the very service</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 1, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
stipendium: <entryFree id="n45427" type="main" key="sti_pendi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stīpendĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>contr. from stipipendium, from stips-pendo</etym>. <sense id="n45427.0" n="I" level="1"> In publicists' lang., <hi rend="ital">a tax</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impost</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tribute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contribution</hi> (payable in money; whereas vectigal in kind; the former being regarded as the more humiliating; v. stipendiarius, I.): Poeni stipendia pendunt, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=182" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 182</bibl> Müll. (Ann. v. 269 Vahl.); so, <cit><quote lang="la">pendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 20:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 20, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:10" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">conferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solvere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 39, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imponere victis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 54</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">stipendio liberare aliquem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de stipendio recusare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stipendi spem facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:25:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 25, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45427.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n45427.2" n="1" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">tribute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dues</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">indomito nec dira ferens stipendia tauro (sc. Minotauro),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 173</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae finis aut quod me manet stipendium?</quote> <trans><tr>penalty</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:17:36" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 17, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alii tamen obscuriores (scriptores) aliquod stipendium nostro studio contulerunt,</quote> <trans><tr>contribution</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:1:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 1, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45427.3" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Income</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subsistence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">salary</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">iis, ut adsiduae templi antistites essent, stipendium de publico statuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:20:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 20, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45427.4" n="II" level="1"> In milit. lang., <hi rend="ital">pay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stipend</hi> in full: <cit><quote lang="la">stipendium militare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:60:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 60, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 3, 13, § 45</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">commonly stipendium alone: militis stipendia ideo, quod eam stipem pendebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=182" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 182</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 3, 13, § 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 59</bibl> and 60: <cit><quote lang="la">cum stipendium ab legionibus flagitaretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numerare militibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:36:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 36, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">persolvere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 14, 1</bibl></cit>: dare, Brut. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 12</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">dare pecuniam in stipendium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">accipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stipendio afficere exercitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:27:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 27, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">augere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fraudare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stipendium duum mensium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:1:45" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 1, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum in calamitosis stipendiis versaretur,</quote> <trans><tr>might get pay by the misfortunes of others</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 19, 12, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45427.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">military service</hi> (mostly in <number>plur.</number>): <cit><quote lang="la">merere stipendia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stipendia merere (mereri),</quote> <trans><tr>to perform military service</tr>, <tr>to serve</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 5, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:64:258" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 64, 258</bibl>; also, <cit><quote lang="la">facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 63:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 63, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:34 al" default="NO" valid="yes">42, 34 al.</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">opulenta ac ditia facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">emereri,</quote> <trans><tr>to complete the time of service</tr>, <tr>to serve out one's time</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 6</bibl></cit>; Cic. <cb n="STIP" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:14:49" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> 14, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 84:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 84, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:1:10" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 1, 10</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">v. emereo, II.: auxiliaria stipendia mereri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numerare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">enumerare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui (milites) jam stipendiis confecti erant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:9:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 9, 26</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">stipendiis exhausti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adulescentuli statim castrensibus stipendiis imbuebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:14:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 14, 5</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo nullius stipendii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 85:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 85, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitui dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 2:96:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 96, 6</bibl></cit> Dietsch: <cit><quote lang="la">sextus decimus stipendii annus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45427.6" n="2" level="3"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">military service of a year</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a year's service</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a campaign</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si in singulis stipendiis is ad hostes exuvias dabit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod tricena aut quadragena stipendia senes tolerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vicena stipendia meritis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stipendia sua numerari jubebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:11:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 12, 11, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui eorum minime multa stipendia haberet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 8</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.—Sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(juventus) octavo jam stipendio functa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:8:2" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 8, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">with both numbers together: secundo stipendio dextram manum perdidit, stipendiis duobus ter et vicies vulneratus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:28:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 28, 29</bibl></cit> § 104.—</sense><sense id="n45427.7" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">service</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">functus omnibus humanae vitae stipendiis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>duties</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 93:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 93, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tamquam emeritis stipendiis libidinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:14:49" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 14, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plurium velut emeritis annorum stipendiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:6:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 6, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rex cui (Hercules) duodecim stipendia debebat,</quote> <trans><tr>services</tr>, <tr>labors</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:4:18" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 4, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
stipes: <entryFree id="n45428" type="main" key="sti_pe^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stīpĕs</orth>, <itype>ĭtis</itype> (collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">stips</orth>, <itype>stīpis</itype>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 43, 5</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>root stip-, = Gr. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>-; v. stipo; Sanscr. sthapa-jami, to cause to stand, to fix, place; cf. stipula</etym>. <sense id="n45428.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a log</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stock</hi>, <hi rend="ital">post</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trunk of a tree</hi>, etc. (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: palus, sudes),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:289" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 289</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:1:11" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 1, 11</bibl> (21); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 2, 18; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:451" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 451</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:642" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 2, 642</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 506</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:524" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 524</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:10:30" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 10, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:3:10" default="NO">4, 3, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">deligare ad stipitem,</quote> <trans><tr>to a stake</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:29" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 29</bibl></cit>.—As a term of contempt, like our <hi rend="ital">log</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stock</hi>, <hi rend="ital">post</hi>, of a stupid person: <cit><quote lang="la">in me quidvis harum rerum convenit, Quae sunt dicta in stultum, caudex, stipes, asinus, plumbeus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui, tamquam truncus atque stipes, si stetisset modo, posset sustinere tamen titulum consulatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:9:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 9, 19</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Har. Resp. 3, 5</bibl>; id. ap. Senat. 6, 14; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Eutr. 1, 126</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45428.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <usg type="style">poet.</usg> </sense><sense id="n45428.2" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A tree</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:37" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 37</bibl>; id. de Nuce, 32; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:444" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 444</bibl>; Claud. Cons. Prob. et Olybr. 179.—</sense><sense id="n45428.3" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A branch of a tree</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:820" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 820</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:19:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 19, 2</bibl>: candelabri, <hi rend="ital">the main stem</hi> of the candlestick, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:37:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 37, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stipidosus: <entryFree id="n45429" type="main" key="sti_pi^do_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stīpĭdōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>stipes</etym>, <sense id="n45429.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">woody</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ligneous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">radix,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 67</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">74</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stipo: <entryFree id="n45430" type="main" key="sti_po"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stīpo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym><foreign lang="greek">ste/fw</foreign>, to surround, crowd upon, <foreign lang="greek">ste/mma, ste/fanos</foreign>; cf.: stipator, stipulor</etym>, <sense id="n45430.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to crowd</hi> or <hi rend="ital">press together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to compress</hi> (class.; esp. of personal objects, and in <hi rend="ital">part. perf.;</hi> cf.: comprimo, compono). </sense><sense id="n45430.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui acceperant majorem numerum (assium), non in arcā ponebant, sed in aliquā cellā stipabant, id est componebant, quo minus loci occuparet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=182" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 182</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">ingens argentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:465" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 465</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apes mella Stipant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 4, 164</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:433" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 433</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">materies stipata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:345" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 345</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec tamen undique corporea stipata tenentur omnia naturā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:329" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 329</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:294" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 294</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:611" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 611</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:664" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 664</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Graeci stipati, quini in lectulis, saepe plures,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:27:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 27, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">velut stipata phalanx,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita in arto stipatae erant naves, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fratrum stipata cohors,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:328" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 328</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: stipare Platona Menandro, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to pack up together the works of Plato</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Menander</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">custodum gregibus circa seu stipat euntem,</quote> <trans><tr>closely surrounds her with</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:8" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 8</bibl></cit> (4, 7), 13; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">mid.: cuncta praecipiti stipantur saecula cursu,</quote> <trans><tr>throng</tr>, <tr>crowd</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 2, 311</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45430.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to press</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cram</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stuff</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">fill full</hi> of any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">ut pontes calonibus et impedimentis stipatos reperit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:51" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hos (poëtas) ediscit et hos arcto stipata theatro Spectat Roma,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 60</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">curia cum patribus fuerit stipata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:1:143" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 3, 1, 143</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multo Patrum stipatur curia coetu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:503" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 11, 503</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">recessus equi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribunal,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:33:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 33, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calathos prunis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:405" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 405</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nucein sulfure,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:19" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calceum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Virg. Vel. 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tectum omne,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 130, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45430.3" n="B" level="2"> With a personal object, of a dense crowd, <hi rend="ital">to surround</hi>, <hi rend="ital">encompass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">environ</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accompany</hi>,<pb n="1761" /> <cb n="STIP" />  etc. (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">comitor, prosequor): Catilina stipatus choro juventutis, vallatus indicibus atque sicariis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:24:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 24, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui stipatus semper sicariis, saeptus armatis, munitus indicibus fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:44:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 44, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stipati gregibus amicorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 18, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">telis stipati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 5, 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui senatum stiparit armatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 12, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stipatus lictoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:40:section=86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 40, § 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senectus stipata studiis juventutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:9:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 9, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comitum turba est stipata suarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:186" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 186</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juventus stipat ducem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:7:557" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 7, 557</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:23" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 23</bibl>; Capitol. Max. et Balb. 13.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnă stipante catervă,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 136</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">huc coetus ministrūm stipantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:1:87" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 1, 87</bibl></cit>. —Hence, * <orth extent="full" lang="la">stīpātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">begirt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">surrounded</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab omni ordine, sexu, aetate stipatissimus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 3, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
stips: <entryFree id="n45431" type="main" key="stips1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stips</orth>, <itype>stĭpis</itype> (<case>nom.</case> does not occur, although stips is assumed by <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=182" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 182</bibl> Müll.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> 85</bibl> P.; cf. Gloss. stips, <foreign lang="greek">e)/ranos</foreign>), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>kindr. with stipo, and therefore, orig., small coin in heaps; hence, in partic.</etym>, <sense id="n45431.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a gift</hi>, <hi rend="ital">donation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">alms</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contribution</hi>, given in small coin: <cit><quote lang="la">etiam nunc dis cum thesauris asses dant, stipem dicunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=182" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 182</bibl></cit> Müll.: stipem esse nummum signatum testimonio est, quod datur in stipendium militi et cum spondetur pecunia, quod stipulari dicitur, Fest. pp. 296 and 297 Müll.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">stipendium a stipe appellatum est, quod per stipes, id est modica aera colligatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:27" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stipem Apollini conferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 12</bibl></cit>; so of religious <hi rend="ital">donations</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:25" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:9:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 9, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 16, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:57" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 57</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis beneficium dicat quadram panis aut stipem aeris abjecti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 4:29:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 4, 29, 2</bibl></cit>; so of <hi rend="ital">alms</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vit. Beat. 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:22:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 22, 1</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:91" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 91 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad captandas stipes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:189" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 189</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pastiones non minimam colono stipem conferunt,</quote> <trans><tr>bring in no small profit</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:1:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suburbanum hortum exiguā colere stipe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:1:19" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 1, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parvā cur stipe quaerat opes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:350" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 350</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:12:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 12, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">e prostitutis ancilla mercenariae stipis,</quote> <trans><tr>living by the wages of prostitution</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 63, 83, § 172</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nodosam exsolvite stipem,</quote> <trans><tr>penalty</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:9:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 9, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n45432" type="main" key="stips2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stips</orth>, <itype>īpis</itype>, v. stipes <sense id="n45432.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
stipula: <entryFree id="n45433" type="main" key="sti^pu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stĭpŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>stipes</etym>, <sense id="n45433.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a stalk</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stem</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blade</hi>, <hi rend="ital">halm;</hi> of grain (syn. culmus): <cit><quote lang="la">frumenta in viridi stipulā lactentia turgent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:315" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 315</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 16, 19, § 101</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:260" default="NO" valid="yes">17, 27, 47, § 260</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:169" default="NO" valid="yes">18, 18, 47, § 169</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">e segete ad spicilegium stipulam relinquere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=109" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 109</bibl></cit> Müll.—Of the stalks of grain left behind in reaping, <hi rend="ital">straw</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stubble</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:53" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:3:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 3, 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:321" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 321</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:8:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 8, 90</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:781" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 781</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in stipulā placidi carpebat munera somni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:185" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 185</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:30" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 30</bibl>.—Of <hi rend="ital">hay</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:49:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 49, 1</bibl>.—Of a <hi rend="ital">reed</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 67, § 182</bibl>.—Of <hi rend="ital">bean-stalks</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:725" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 725</bibl>. —Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">flammaque de stipulā nostra brevisque fuit,</quote> <trans><tr>of a quickly extinguished fire</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:8:20" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 8, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postmodo de stipulā magnus acervus erit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:8:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 8, 90</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
stipulatio: <entryFree id="n45434" type="main" key="sti^pu^la_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stĭpŭlātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>stipulor</etym>, jurid. t. t., <sense id="n45434.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a promise given on demand; an engagement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">agreement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bargain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">covenant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stipulation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obligation</hi> (syn. pactum), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 2:31" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 2, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">stipulatio est verborum conceptio, quibus is qui interrogatur, daturum facturumve se, quod interrogatus est, respondet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:45:1:5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 45, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stipulatio non potest confici, nisi utroque loquente, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:45:1:1 sq" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 45, 1, 1 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pacta, conventa, stipulationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:24:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 24, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ea pecunia ex stipulatione debeatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:21:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 21, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem stipulatione alligare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:12:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 12, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nondum stipulationes legeram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:11:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 11, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stipulationum et judiciorum formulas conponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:4:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 4, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 9, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 3:19" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 3, 19</bibl> pr.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 5, 7, 1</bibl>: is contractus stipulationum sponsionum sponsalia, Serv. Suip. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:4:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 4, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:32:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jer. 32, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stipulatiuncula: <entryFree id="n45435" type="hapax" key="sti^pu^la_ti^uncu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stĭpŭlātĭuncŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>stipulatio</etym>, <sense id="n45435.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insignificant promise</hi> or <hi rend="ital">stipulation</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:38:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 38, 174</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stipulator: <entryFree id="n45436" type="main" key="sti^pu^la_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stĭpŭlātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>stipulor</etym>, jurid. t. t., <sense id="n45436.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who demands a formal promise</hi> or <hi rend="ital">covenant</hi> (opp. promissor, the one who gives the promise); <hi rend="ital">a bargainer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stipulator</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:10:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 2, 10, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:45:1:41" default="NO">45, 1, 41</bibl> sq.; 45, 38, 5; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:14" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 10, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stipulatus: <entryFree id="n45437" type="main" key="sti^pu^la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stĭpŭlātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, jurid. t. t., <sense id="n45437.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a</hi> <cb n="STIR" /> <hi rend="ital">promise formally demanded; a bargain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stipulation</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 12:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 12, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid adversus pactionem fiat, non ex stipulatu agitur, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 3:94" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 3, 94</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:4:116" default="NO">4, 116</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:45:1:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 45, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:45:1:4" default="NO">45, 1, 4</bibl> sq.; 45, 1, 103 sq.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 5, 7, 2 sq.</bibl> al.</sense></entryFree>
stipulo: <entryFree id="n45438" type="main" key="sti^pu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stĭpŭlo</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> (collat. form of stipulor), <sense id="n45438.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to exact</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bargain for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stipulate</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 1:11" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 1, 11</bibl>: <foreign lang="greek">e)perwtw=</foreign>, stipulo, Gloss.; mostly <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: Suetonius autem passivo protulit in IIII. Pratorum, Laetoria, quae vetat minorem annis viginti quinque stipulari (<foreign lang="greek">e)perwta=sqai</foreign>), <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 8, 4, 21, p. 794</bibl> P.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 18, 19, 149, p. 1164</bibl> ib.—<hi rend="ital">Part. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecunia stipulata (for promissa),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 5, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
stipulor: <entryFree id="n45439" type="main" key="sti^pu^lor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stĭpŭlor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype> (<sense id="n45439.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> paragog. stipularier, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 6, 14</bibl>), <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=182" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 182</bibl> Müll., kindr. with stips: qui pecuniam alligat, stipulari et restipulari; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: cum spondetur pecunia, stipulari dicitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=297" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 297</bibl></cit> Müll.—More prob. from unused <pos>adj.</pos> stipulus, firm, from root stip-; v. stipo</etym>, jurid. t. t., <hi rend="ital">to demand a formal promise; to bargain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">covenant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stipulate.</hi> </sense><sense id="n45439.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">stipularier,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:6:14 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 6, 14 sq.</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 115</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 3:92 sq" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 3, 92 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">itaque stipulantur sic, Illas capras hodie recte esse et bibere posse habereque recte licere, haec spondesne?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:3:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 3, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 2:5:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si is, cui legatum est, stipulatus est id ipsum, quod legatum est, ut ea pecunia ex stipulatione debeatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:21:53" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 21, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reliquum est, ut stipulatum se esse dicat. ... Stipulatus es? ubi? quo praesente? quis spopondisse me dicit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantumvis stipulare, et protinus accipe quod do,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>ask</tr>, <tr>demand</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:165" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 165</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod stipulanti spoponderam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10 praef" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10 praef.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:45:1:4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 45, 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:46:7:3" default="NO">46, 7, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45439.2" n="II" level="1"> Sometimes transf., of him who gives the promise or pledges himself (for the usu. promittere), <hi rend="ital">to promise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">engage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pledge one's self</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quis usuras solverit, quas non erat stipulatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:46:3:5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 46, 3, 5</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:6:26" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 12, 6, 26 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:4:7" default="NO">13, 4, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stipulus: <entryFree id="n45440" type="main" key="sti^pu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stĭpŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> (old Lat.), <sense id="n45440.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">firm</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">stipulum apud veteres firmum appellabatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 3:15" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 3, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 5, 7, § 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stiria: <entryFree id="n45441" type="main" key="sti_ri^a1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stīrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>cf. stilla; Engl. tear</etym>, <sense id="n45441.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a frozen drop; an ice-drop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ice-drop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">icicle</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:366" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 366</bibl>; so too <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 12, 32, § 124</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:37:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 37, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> B. Get. 327</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n45442" type="main" key="Sti^ri^a2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Stĭrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n45442.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an island near the coast of Cilicia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 31, 35, § 129</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stiriacus: <entryFree id="n45443" type="hapax" key="sti_ri^a^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stīrĭăcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>stiria</etym>, <sense id="n45443.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">frozen</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gutta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 27 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
stiricidium: <entryFree id="n45444" type="main" key="sti_ri^ci^di^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stīrĭcĭdĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>stiria-cado</etym>, <sense id="n45444.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a falling of snow-flakes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a snowing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">stiricidium quasi stillicidium, cum stillae concretae frigore cadunt. Stiria enim principale est, stilla deminutivum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=345" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 345</bibl></cit> Müll.; so Cato <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=344" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> p. 344</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stirpes: <entryFree id="n45445" type="main" key="stirpes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stirpes</orth>, v. stirps <sense id="n45445.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
stirpesco: <entryFree id="n45446" type="hapax" key="stirpesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stirpesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n45446.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [stirps], <hi rend="ital">to run to stalk</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">asparagus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 8, 42, § 149</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
stirpitus: <entryFree id="n45447" type="main" key="stirpi^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stirpĭtus</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>id.; cf. radicitus from radix</etym>, <sense id="n45447.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">by the stalk</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by the roots</hi>, <hi rend="ital">root and branch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stock and stump</hi> (very rare). * </sense><sense id="n45447.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">arborem transferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:7:3:section=4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 7, 3, § 4</bibl></cit>. —* </sense><sense id="n45447.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">barbam forcipibus evellere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 1, 2</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n45447.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (for the usu. radicitus), <hi rend="ital">utterly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc errorem, quasi radicem malorum omnium, stirpitus extrahere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:38:83" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 38, 83</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
stirps: <entryFree id="n45448" type="main" key="stirps"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stirps</orth> (collat. form of the <case>nom.</case> <orth extent="full" lang="la">stir-pes</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">stirpis</orth>, in the best MSS., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:8:10" default="NO" valid="yes">41, 8, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:13:16" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 13, 16</bibl>; v. Drak. ad locc.), <itype>pis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-Aug.; also <gen>m.</gen>, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=313" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 313</bibl> Müll., and ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 226, 32</bibl> (Ann. 184); Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 227, 2</bibl> (Trag. Fragm. 421), and ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 85</bibl> P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 40, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:379" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 379</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:208" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 12, 208</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 770</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 781</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:9:13" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 9, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 26, 40, § 96</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 2</bibl>) [root star-; cf. sternere; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">store/nnumi</foreign>; prop. that which extends or spreads]. <sense id="n45448.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the lower part of the trunk</hi> of plants, including the roots; <hi rend="ital">a stock</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stem</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stalk; a root</hi> (class. and very freq.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">radix): arborum altitudo nos delectat. radices stirpesque non item,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:43:147" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 43, 147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra stirpes amplexa alat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:33:83" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 33, 83</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 10, 26</bibl>; 2, 47, 120; <cit><quote lang="la">2, 51, 127: ut tantum modo per stirpis alantur suas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 32, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sceptrum in silvis imo de stirpe recisum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:208" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 208</bibl></cit>: harundo omnis ex unā stirpe numerosa, Plin. <cb n="STLE" /> 16, 36, 65, § <cit><quote lang="la">163: palmarum stirpibus ali,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:38:section=99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 38, § 99</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">palmarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 50</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">131 (for which: radices palmarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 33</bibl></cit>, § 87); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">lento in stirpe moratus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:781" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 781</bibl></cit> (for which, just before: <cit><quote lang="la">lentā in radice): stirpes raptas volvere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:29:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 29, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">validis amplexae stirpibus ulmos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:367" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 367</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic stirpes obruit arvo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domos avium cum stirpibus imis Eruit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 209</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">of hair: vellere albos ab stirpe capillos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl></cit> (4), 25, 13; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:8:45" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 8, 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex hac nimiā licentiā, ut ex stirpe quādam, exsistere, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:44:68" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 44, 68</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45448.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n45448.2" n="1" level="3"> Of vegetables. </sense><sense id="n45448.3" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shrub</hi> (esp. freq. in <number>plur.</number>): <cit><quote lang="la">stirpium naturae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:4:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 4, 10</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum arborum et stirpium eadem paene natura sit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 11, 33</bibl></cit>; so (with arbores) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:22:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 22, 55</bibl>; (with herbae) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:64:161" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 64, 161</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pati (terram) stirpium asperitate vastari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 39, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stirpes tenent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">internatas saxis stirpes et herbas vellentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 60</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45448.4" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A shoot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sprout</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rami stirpesque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stirpem praecisum circumligato, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 40, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">probatissimum genus stirpis deponere, i. e. malleolos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:5:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stirpem post annum praecidi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:6:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stirpis committere ramis,</quote> <trans><tr>engraft</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1365" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1365</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45448.5" n="2" level="3"> Of persons. </sense><sense id="n45448.6" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A stem</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stock</hi>, <hi rend="ital">race</hi>, <hi rend="ital">family</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lineage</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">genus, familia): ignoratio stirpis et generis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:19:70" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 19, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stirpis ac gentilitatis jus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:39:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 39, 176</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui sunt ejusdem stirpis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Post. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: a stirpe supremo, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 226, 32</bibl> (Ann. v. 184 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">divinae stirpis Acestes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:711" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 711</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Priami de stirpe,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 297</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Herculis stirpe generatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:12:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 12, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hinc orti stirpe antiquissimā sumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:1:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominum sceleratorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab stirpe socius et amicus populi Romani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 14, 2</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">unum relictum, stirpem genti Fabiae futurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 50 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n45448.7" n="b" level="4"> Like Engl. <hi rend="ital">scion</hi>, = <hi rend="ital">offspring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">descendant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">progeny</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>; not in Cic.): stirps liberum, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=16" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 16</bibl> Müll. (Trag. v. 317 Vahl.); so, <cit><quote lang="la">liberum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 11</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquis magnā de stirpe nepotum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:864" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 864</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stirps et genus omne futurum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 622</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">en stirps et progenies tot consulum, tot dictatorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 37 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stirpis virilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 1, 11</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui stirpem ex sese domi relinquerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:8:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 41, 8, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45448.8" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">source</hi>, <hi rend="ital">origin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">foundation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">first beginning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cause</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">altae stirpes stultitiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:6:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">superstitionis stirpes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:72:149" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 72, 149</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:32:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 32, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quā ex stirpe orirentur amicitiae cognationum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:7:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 7, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quodsi exquiratur usque ab stirpe auctoritas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 180</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populum a stirpe repetere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:12:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 12, 21</bibl></cit> Mos.: <cit><quote lang="la">repetam stirpem juris a naturā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:6:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 6, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stirps ac semen malorum omnium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:12:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 12, 30</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ea pars, quae quasi stirps est hujus quaestionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:2:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non ingenerantur hominibus mores tam a stirpe generis ac seminis, quam, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>original nature</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:35:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 35, 95</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">exoletā stirpe gentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 8, 4</bibl></cit>.—So esp. in phrase ab stirpe, <hi rend="ital">utterly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Karthago ab stirpe interiit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 10, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gens ab stirpe exstincta est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:34:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 34, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omne genus ab stirpe sublatum esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 2, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis intra annum cum stirpe exstinctos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:29:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 29, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">velut ab stirpibus renata urbs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 1, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
stiva: <entryFree id="n45449" type="main" key="sti_va"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stīva</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n45449.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plough-handle</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=135" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 135</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 174</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:218" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 218</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:825" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 825</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:9:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 9, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 4, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stivarius: <entryFree id="n45450" type="main" key="sti_va_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stīvārĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>stiva</etym>, <sense id="n45450.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a ploughman</hi> (late Lat.), Aldhel. Laud. Virg. 28.</sense></entryFree>
stlata: <entryFree id="n45451" type="main" key="stla_ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stlāta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. latus, q. v. <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></etym>, <sense id="n45451.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of ship</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">stlata genus navigii latum magis quam altum, et a latitudine sic appellatum, sed eā consuetudine, quā stlocum pro locum et stlitem pro litem dicebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=312" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 312</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 22, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:25:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 25, 5</bibl>.— Acc. to Caper, Orth. p. 2246 P., and Gloss. Philox. s. h. v., <hi rend="ital">a kind of piratical vessel</hi> or <hi rend="ital">corsair</hi>: stlatta, <foreign lang="greek">peiratikou= ska/feos ei)=dos</foreign>.</sense></entryFree>
stlatarius: <entryFree id="n45452" type="main" key="stla_ta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stlātārĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">stlatt-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>stlata</etym>, <sense id="n45452.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a ship</hi> (very rare), Enn. ap. Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:134" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 134</bibl> (Ann. v. 469 Vahl.). —<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, transf.; stlataria purpura, <hi rend="ital">brought by ship</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">costly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:134" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 134</bibl> Schol. (al. <hi rend="ital">deceitful</hi>, cf. Mayor ad Juv. l. l.).</sense></entryFree>
stlembus: <entryFree id="n45453" type="main" key="stlembus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stlembus</orth>, <itype>gravis tardus, sicut Lucilius pedibus stlembum dixit equum pigrum et tardum</itype>, Fest. pp. 312 and 313 Müll. <pb n="1762" /> <cb n="STO" /></entryFree>
stlis: <entryFree id="n45454" type="main" key="stlis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stlis</orth>, v. lis <sense id="n45454.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
stlocus: <entryFree id="n45455" type="main" key="stlo^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stlŏcus</orth>, v. locus <sense id="n45455.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
stloppus: <entryFree id="n45456" type="hapax" key="stloppus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stloppus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n45456.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a slap</hi> (the sound produced by striking upon the inflated cheek), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:13" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sto: <entryFree id="n45457" type="main" key="sto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sto</orth>, <itype>stĕti, stătum, 1</itype> (scanned stĕtĕrunt, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:774" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 774</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:7:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 7, 166</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:8:10" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 8, 10</bibl>), <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>root sta-; Sanscr. sthā, sthalam, locus; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">sta-, i(/sthmi</foreign>, to set, place; <foreign lang="greek">stath/r</foreign>, weight; O. H. Germ. stām; Goth. standa; Engl. stand</etym>, <sense id="n45457.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to stand</hi>, in opposition to sitting, walking, or lying prostrate, <hi rend="ital">to stand still</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remain standing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stand upright.</hi> </sense><sense id="n45457.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n45457.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">hos quos videtis stare hic captivos duos, Illi qui astant, hi stant ambo, non sedent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:prol. 1 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. prol. 1 sq.</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum virgo staret et Caecilia in sellā sederet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:46:104" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 46, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si iste ibit, ito: stabit, astato simul,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abi intro, noli stare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:3:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 3, 36</bibl></cit>; so (opp. ire) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 3, 3, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 95</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 9, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:3:3:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 3, 3, 43</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 4, 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 2, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">i: quid stas, lapis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 4, 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante aedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:1:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 1, 56</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 1, 250</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 3, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante ostium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 3, 1, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 3, 4, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 4, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante oculos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:5:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 5, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad januam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:86:353" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 86, 353</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad undam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:356" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 356</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orantem juxta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:11:618" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 11, 618</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic foris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 2, 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hinc procul,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propter in occulto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:28:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 28, 78</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui proximi steterant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:35:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 35, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:361" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 361</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sta ilico,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 4, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui frequentissimi in gradibus concordiae steterunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:7:8:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 7, 8, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stans pede in uno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 10</bibl></cit> et saep.—Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">ita statim stant signa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum statuae steterunt in Rostris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:9:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 9, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:34:75" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 34, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">signa ad impluvium, ad valvas Junonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:23:section=61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 23, § 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stabat acuta silex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:233" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 233</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">columna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:35:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 35, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cerea effigies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:8:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 8, 32</bibl></cit>; cf. <usg type="style">poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aeneus ut stes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 183</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Pass. impers.: Ps.</hi> Statur hic ad hunc modum. <hi rend="ital">Sim.</hi> Statum vide hominis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 44</bibl>: <hi rend="ital">Gn.</hi> Quid agitur? <hi rend="ital">Pa.</hi> Statur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">confecto munerum cursu moriar stando,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 24, 3, 7</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">inter sacrum saxumque sto, nec quid faciam scio,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>I am in a pinch</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 84</bibl></cit>; v. sacrum.—</sense><sense id="n45457.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n45457.4" n="1" level="3"> Pregn., <hi rend="ital">to stand firm</hi> or <hi rend="ital">immovable; to last</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">continue</hi>: cui nec arae patriae domi stant; fractae et disjectae jacent, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:19:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 19, 44</bibl> (Trag. v. 115 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">nec domus ulla nec urbs stare poterit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:7:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 7, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stantibus Hierosolymis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 28, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut praeter spem stare muros viderunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbem innoxiam stare incolumem pati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:31:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 31, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hasta, quae radice novā, non ferro stabat adacto,</quote> <trans><tr>stuck fast</tr>, <tr>remained fixed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:562" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 562</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">missum stetit inguine ferrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:132" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 132</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 34</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">8, 415: stat glacies iners,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 9, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:732" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 732</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longā stare senectā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:94" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cornus stetit inter tempora frontis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:142" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 142</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45457.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To remain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tarry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">linger</hi> any where (cf. moror): <cit><quote lang="la">paulisper stetimus in illā ganearum tuarum nidore atque fumo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hos quos video volitare in foro, quos stare ad curiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: cur non aut stantem comprehenderint, aut fugientem consecuti sint, <hi rend="ital">remaining in the city</hi>, id. Cael, 28, 67; <cit><quote lang="la">so (opp. fugio),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:23:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 23, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum gladiis in conspectu senatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui domi stare non poterant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(meretrix) olente in fornice stans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 30</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:10:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 10, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:239" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 239</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">of minerals not attracted by the magnet: pondere enim fretae partim stant, quod genus aurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1058" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1058</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n45457.6" n="3" level="3"> In milit. lang. </sense><sense id="n45457.7" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To stand in the ranks</hi> or <hi rend="ital">under arms</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to fight</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quisque uti steterat, jacet obtinetque ordinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 86</bibl></cit>: ut sustinere corpora plerique nequeuntes arma sua quisque stantes incumberet, Sall. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 9, 229</bibl> (H. 3, 72 Dietsch): <cit><quote lang="la">cum milites a mane diei jejuni sub armis stetissent defatigati, Auct. B. Afr. 42, 3: primo haud impari stetere acie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Asia totius Asiae steterunt vires,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 58</bibl></cit>: in acie, Auct. B. Hisp. 28 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars acie stabat, Auct. B.
