Aur.</author> Acut. 1, 7, 9 sq.</bibl>; <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 4:8:115" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tard. 4, 8, 115</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:5:4:64" default="NO">5, 4, 64</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45575.1" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Pressure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suffering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">torment</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dura,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Juvenc.</author> 2, 789</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vehementior est virtutis strictura quam poenae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Spir. Sanc. 1, 9, § 108</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45575.2" n="II" level="1"> In concr., <hi rend="ital">a mass of wrought iron</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a bar of iron</hi>, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 21, 11</bibl>; Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> A. 10, 173</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 14, 41, § 143</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:421" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 421</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
strictus: <entryFree id="n45576" type="main" key="strictus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strictus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from stringo.</entryFree>
strideo: <entryFree id="n45577" type="main" key="stri_deo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strīdeo</orth>, <itype>di, 2</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">strīdo</orth>, <itype>di, 3</itype> (both forms equally in use; <sense id="n45577.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">in the foll.</ref></xr>) [perh. root star, to resound; cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">tri/zw, to/rgos</foreign>; also Lat. turdus, sterto, trisso], <pos>v. n.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to make</hi> or <hi rend="ital">utter any harsh</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shrill</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hissing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whistling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grating</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">creaking sound; to creak</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hiss</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whizz</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whistle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rattle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">buzz</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>; cf.: strepo, fremo): ferri stridit acumen, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 838</bibl> P. (Ann. v. 364 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">striderat hasta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> p. 817 P. (Ann. v. 365 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">candens ferrum e fornacibus Stridit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 149</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:450" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 450</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 171</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 279</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">striduntque cavernis Stricturae chalybum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:420" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 420</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">serpentum Cerberus ore Stridet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:3:72" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 3, 72</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:288" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 288</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">striges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:140" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gryllus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 6, 39, § 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">barbaraque horribili stridebat tibia cantu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:264" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 264</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">serrae stridentis acerbus Horror,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:410" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 410</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">foribus cardo aënis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:449" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 449</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plaustra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:536" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 3, 536</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare refluentibus undis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 262</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alae cygnorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:397" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 397</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sagitta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 319</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 502</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">silvae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 418</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rudentes aquilone,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:11:19" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 11, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aeger dentibus stridet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 6 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jecur in verubus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Thyest. 770" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Thyest. 770</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">funes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:26:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 26, 4</bibl></cit>.—With human subjects, of any loud or inharmonious sound: quidnam hoc soniti est, quod stridunt foris? Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 491, 24</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 133 Rib.). cum striderat (Alcestis) retracta rursus inferis, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 9, p. 867</bibl> P. (Trag. Rel. v. 57 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">Troglodytae stridunt magis quam loquuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:8" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stridunt animae currumque sequuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:7:770" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 7, 770</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pressoque diu stridere molari,</quote> <trans><tr>gnash</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:160" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 160</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
strido: <entryFree id="n45578" type="main" key="stri_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strīdo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, v. strideo.</entryFree>
stridor: <entryFree id="n45579" type="main" key="stri_dor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strīdor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>strideo</etym>, <sense id="n45579.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">any harsh</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shrill</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hissing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grating</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">creaking sound; a creaking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hissing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rattling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">buzzing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whizzing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whistling</hi>, etc. (class.; esp. freq. in the poets; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">strepitus, clangor): serpentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 65</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:287" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 287</bibl>: elephantorum, <cb n="STRI" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. Afr. 72:5" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. Afr. 72, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:84:1" default="NO">84, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:5" default="NO" valid="yes">44, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">stellionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volant pinnarum stridore (locustae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 29, 35, § 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Troglodytis stridor, non vox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 8, 8, § 45</bibl></cit>: horrifer Aquiloni' stridor, Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:28:68" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 28, 68</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 567 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">ne stridorem quidem serrae, cum acuitur (audiunt),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:40:116" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 40, 116</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">id. poët. Div. 1, 7, 13: procellae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:7" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 7</bibl></cit> (4, 6), 47: <cit><quote lang="la">rudentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 87</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:495" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 495</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">januae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:11:608" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 608</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:267" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 51, 112, § 267</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pinnarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 29, 35, § 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lituum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:237" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 237</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">catenae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:23" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">harena, quae manu confricata fecerit stridorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 4</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">tribuni plebis stridor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:26:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 26, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stridor acutus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:34:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 34, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:6:179" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 6, 179</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 122</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">consonantium tristior stridor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:37" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 37</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">stridores aurium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 6, 21, § 45</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
stridulus: <entryFree id="n45580" type="main" key="stri_du^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strīdŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>strideo</etym>, <sense id="n45580.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">creaking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rattling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hissing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whizzing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">buzzing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stridulous</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">stridula cornus (i. e. hasta),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:267" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 267</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fraxinus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Ruf. 3, 218</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plaustra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:12:30" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 12, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fax lacrimoso stridula fumo fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 10, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus monstri (i. e. elephanti),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:9:627" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 9, 627</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stridula et tenuis vox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 56:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 56, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">examina apum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Cons. Hon. 4, 380</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
striga: <entryFree id="n45581" type="main" key="stri^ga1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strĭga</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>stringo</etym>. <sense id="n45581.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A row of grain</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hay cut down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a swath</hi>, <hi rend="ital">windrow</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:18:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 18, 2</bibl>; cf. Fest. s. h. v. pp. 314 and 315. —</sense><sense id="n45581.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A furrow drawn lengthwise of the field</hi>, Jul. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Agr. p. 38" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Agr. p. 38</bibl>.—In a camp, <hi rend="ital">the spaces between the squadrons</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> 1, p. 85</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n45582" type="main" key="stri_ga2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strīga</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. strix</etym>, a woman that brings harm to children, <sense id="n45582.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hag</hi>, <hi rend="ital">witch</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 63</bibl>; cf. Fest. s. v. strigem, p. 314 Müll.: striga, <foreign lang="greek">gunh\ farmaki/s</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
strigatus: <entryFree id="n45583" type="hapax" key="stri^ga_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strĭgātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. strix</etym>, among surveyors: ager, <sense id="n45583.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a field whose length</hi> (or measurement from north to south) <hi rend="ital">is greater than its breadth</hi> (opp. scamnatus), <bibl default="NO"><author>Aggen.</author> p. 46</bibl> Goes.</sense></entryFree>
strigilecula: <entryFree id="n45584" type="hapax" key="stri^gi^le_cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strĭgĭlēcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>strigilis</etym>, <sense id="n45584.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small strigil</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. p. 346, 27</bibl>; cf.: strigilecula, <foreign lang="greek">stleggi/dion</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
strigilis: <entryFree id="n45585" type="main" key="stri^gi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strĭgĭlis</orth>, <itype>is</itype> (<sense id="n45585.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> striglium, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 4, 3</bibl>; <case>abl.</case> striglibus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:263" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 263</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>stringo</etym>. </sense><sense id="n45585.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a scraper</hi> (made of horn or metal) used by bathers for removing the impurities of the skin, <hi rend="ital">a strigil</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">stleggi/s</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:3:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 3, 77</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:3:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 1, 3, 44</bibl>; Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 223, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:12:30" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 12, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 110</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:126" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 126</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:80" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 80</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 97:47" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 97, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:263" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 263</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:126" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 126</bibl>; cf. Becker, Gallus, 3, p. 86 (2d. ed.).— </sense><sense id="n45585.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n45585.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A surgical instrument of a similar shape</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for dropping a liquid into the ear</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 13, 103, § 164</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n45585.4" n="B" level="2"> Among the Spaniards, <hi rend="ital">a small bit</hi> of native gold, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 3, 19, § 62</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45585.5" n="C" level="2"> = stria, <hi rend="ital">the flute</hi> of a column, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 4, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
strigmentum: <entryFree id="n45586" type="main" key="strigmentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strigmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n45586.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">that which is scratched</hi> or <hi rend="ital">scraped off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a scraping</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 3, 8, § 17</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n45586.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">filth</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dirt scraped off</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 6 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 51, 74, § 160</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:51" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 4, 13, § 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:14" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 9, 14</bibl>, ext. 2 al.</sense></entryFree>
strigo: <entryFree id="n45587" type="main" key="stri^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strĭgo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>2. strix</etym>. <sense id="n45587.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to hold up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">halt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stop</hi> in ploughing, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 19, 49, § 177</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45587.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n45587.2" n="1" level="3"> In gen., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 31:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 31, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45587.3" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to give out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">give way</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lose strength</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sink</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cat. 8, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
strigosus: <entryFree id="n45588" type="main" key="stri^go_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strĭgōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>stringo</etym>, <sense id="n45588.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">lean</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lank</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">meagre</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n45588.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: equum nimis strigosum et male habitum, sed equitem ejus uberrimum et habitissimum viderunt, Massur. Sabin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:20:11" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 20, 11</bibl>, and ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 168, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">canis (opp. obesus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:12:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 12, 8</bibl></cit>: hic strigosus bovinatorque, Lucil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:7:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 7, 10</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">equi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 47</bibl></cit>: hinno strigosior, Maecen. ap. Suet. Vit. Hor. —<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(capella) strigosissimi corporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:6:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 6, 9</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n45588.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of an orator, <hi rend="ital">meagre</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tasteless</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:16:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 16, 64</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
strigula: <entryFree id="n45589" type="main" key="stri^gu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strĭgŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = strigilis, I., Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:263" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 263</bibl>.</entryFree>
stringo: <entryFree id="n45590" type="main" key="stringo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stringo</orth>, <itype>inxi, ictum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>root strig; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">stragg</foreign>-, to squeeze; <foreign lang="greek">stra/gc</foreign>, a drop; cf. O. H. Germ. streng; Engl. strong</etym>, <sense id="n45590.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to draw tight</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bind</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tie tight; to draw</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bind</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">press together</hi>, etc. (syn. ligo). </sense><sense id="n45590.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">te stringam ad carnarium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stringit vitta comas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 143</bibl></cit>: caesariem <cb n="STRI" /> crinali cultu, Claud. Cons. Prob. et Olybr. 85: <cit><quote lang="la">stricta matutino frigore vulnera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectora pigro gelu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:652" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 652</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">strictos insedimus amnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:414" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 414</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare gelu stringi et consistere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:8:16" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 8, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quercus in duas partes diducta, stricta denuo et cohaesa,</quote> <trans><tr>having closed together</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:16:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 15, 16, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habenam,</quote> <trans><tr>to draw tight</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:11:513" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 11, 513</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:16:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 16, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45590.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (through the intermediate idea of drawing close), <hi rend="ital">to touch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">touch upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">touch lightly</hi> or <hi rend="ital">slightly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to graze</hi> (syn. tango): <cit><quote lang="la">litus ama, et laevas stringat sine palmula cautes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 163</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">stringebat summas ales miserabilis undas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:733" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 733</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequor (aurā),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:136" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">metas interiore rotā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">latus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:11" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 11</bibl></cit> (4, 10), 24: <cit><quote lang="la">vestigia canis rostro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:536" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 536</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">equos,</quote> <trans><tr>to stroke</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> 84</bibl></cit> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">tela stringentia corpus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>slightly touching</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:331" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 331</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 2:6:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 2, 6, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">coluber Dente pedem strinxit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:776" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 776</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">strictus ac recreatus ex vulnere in tempus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:12:44" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 12, 44</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45590.3" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To pull</hi> or <hi rend="ital">strip off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to pluck off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cut off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clip off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prune</hi>, etc. (cf. destringo): <cit><quote lang="la">oleam ubi nigra erit, stringito,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 65, 1</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">oleam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 2, 3, § 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bacam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:55:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 55, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quernas glandes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:305" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 305</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">folia ex arboribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 58</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:30:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 30, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">frondes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:9:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 9, 61</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 14, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hordea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:317" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 317</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:3:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">celeriter gladios strinxerunt,</quote> <trans><tr>drew from the sheath</tr>, <tr>unsheathed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">strictam aciem offerre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:291" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 291</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ensem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 577</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">gladios,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 278</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:333" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 333</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ensem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:207" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 207</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">14, 296: ferrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:40 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 40 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cultrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 5, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:50:3" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 50, 3</bibl>; and <usg type="style">poet.</usg> transf.: <cit><quote lang="la">manum,</quote> <trans><tr>to bare</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 6, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:2:30 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 5, 2, 30 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n45590.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n45590.5" n="A" level="2"> Of speech, <hi rend="ital">to touch upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">treat briefly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:48" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 48</bibl>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">to compress</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abridge</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">narrationis loco rem stringat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:128" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 128</bibl></cit> Spald.—</sense><sense id="n45590.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To hold in check</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to rule</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sway</hi> (syn. coërceo): <cit><quote lang="la">quaecumque meo gens barbara nutu Stringitur, adveniat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> B. Get. 371</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45590.7" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To waste</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consume</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reduce</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeclaram stringat malus ingluvie rem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45590.8" n="D" level="2"> (Acc. to I. B.) <hi rend="ital">To touch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">move</hi>, <hi rend="ital">affect;</hi> esp. <hi rend="ital">to affect painfully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to wound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pain</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">atque animum patriae strinxit pietatis imago,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:294" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 294</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam tua delicto stringantur pectora nostro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:6:21" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 6, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:350" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 350</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n45590.9" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To draw</hi> in hostility, <hi rend="ital">attack with</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hostes stringatur iambus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 377</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:21:1" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 21, 1</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">strictus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> (acc. to I.), <hi rend="ital">drawn together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">close</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strait</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tight</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n45590.10" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">laxaret pedem a stricto nodo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 7, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duriora genti corpora, stricti artus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">strictissima janua,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 233</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si strictior fuerit pedatura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Grom. 3:1" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Grom. 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">emplastrum,</quote> <trans><tr>thick</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 45" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 45 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venter,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>bound up</tr>, <tr>costive</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 3, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">strictior aura,</quote> <trans><tr>more severe</tr>, <tr>colder</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 14, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45590.11" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n45590.12" n="1" level="3"> Of language, <hi rend="ital">brief</hi>, <hi rend="ital">concise</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo minus (Aeschines) strictus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:77" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui (Demosthenes) est strictior multo (quam Cicero),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:52" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 10, 52</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45590.13" n="2" level="3"> Of character, <hi rend="ital">severe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strict</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Catones,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 5, 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 769</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:5:87" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 5, 87</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45590.14" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Rigid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exact</hi> (law Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">restitutio stricto jure non competebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:29:2:85" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 29, 2, 85</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:3:3 al" default="NO">39, 3, 3 al.</bibl>—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">strictē</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">strictim</orth>, <hi rend="ital">closely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tightly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in foramen conicies,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Mart. 8, 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 6</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:3:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 3, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45590.15" n="2" level="3"> Fig., <hi rend="ital">accurately</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">strictius interpretari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:2:20" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 8, 2, 20</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
stringor: <entryFree id="n45591" type="hapax" key="stringor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stringor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>stringo</etym>, <sense id="n45591.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a touching</hi>, <hi rend="ital">touch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shock</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gelidae aquaï,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:693" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 693</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
strio: <entryFree id="n45592" type="main" key="stri^o1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strĭo</orth>, no <sense id="n45592.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>stria</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to furnish with furrows</hi> or <hi rend="ital">channels; to hollow out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">groove</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">striate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">columnas viginti striis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">asparagum in toros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 8, 42, § 146</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">concham,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 33, 52, § 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 5, 11, § 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1:7:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 1, 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conchula,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 297, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frons striata,</quote> <trans><tr>wrinkled</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> M. 10, p. 239, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n45593" type="main" key="stri^o2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, rare collat. form of histrio, Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:1" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 1</bibl>.</entryFree>
stritavus: <entryFree id="n45594" type="gloss" key="stri^ta^vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strĭtăvus</orth>, v. tritavus <sense id="n45594.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
strittabillae: <entryFree id="n45595" type="main" key="strittabillae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strittabillae</orth>, v. strictivilla.</entryFree>
strittare: <entryFree id="n45596" type="gloss" key="stritta_re"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strittāre</orth>, <sense id="n45596.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be weak in the feet</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">strittare ab eo, qui sistit aegre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=65" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 65</bibl></cit> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
strix: <entryFree id="n45597" type="greek" key="strix1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strix</orth>, <itype>strĭgis</itype> (on the ĭ cf. Lachm. <pb n="1767" /> <cb n="STRU" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:II. p. 36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> II. p. 36</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">stri/gc</foreign> [from <foreign lang="greek">stri/zw, tri/zw</foreign>, the screecher], <sense id="n45597.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a screech-owl</hi>, which, according to the belief of the ancients, sucked the blood of young children, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:133 sq" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 133 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:232" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 39, 95, § 232</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:5:52" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 5, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:269" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 269</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 5, 17; 3 (4, 5), 6, 29; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 134, 1</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=314:33" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 314, 33</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n45598" type="main" key="strix2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strix</orth>, <itype>ĭgis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n45598.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a furrow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">channel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">groove</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flute</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">strigium circuitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 1 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 4</bibl> (al. striae; but cf. strigatus and strigo).</sense></entryFree>
strobilus: <entryFree id="n45599" type="greek" key="stro^bi^lus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strŏbĭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">stro/bilos</foreign>, <sense id="n45599.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pine-nut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pine-cone</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:1:55:section=10" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 32, 1, 55, § 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n45600" type="main" key="Stro^bi_lus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Strŏbīlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n45600.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a slave</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 6, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 7, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
strobus: <entryFree id="n45601" type="main" key="stro^bus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strŏbus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">storbus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n45601.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A tree in Carmania</hi>, <hi rend="ital">yielding an odoriferous gum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 17, 40, § 79</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45601.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Another name of the</hi> ladanum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 17, 37, § 74</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stroma: <entryFree id="n45602" type="greek" key="stro_ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strōma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">strw=ma</foreign>, <sense id="n45602.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bedcovering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">coverlet</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Ver. 4, § 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45602.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">strōmăta</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">plur. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">miscellaneous writings</hi>, Hier. Prol. in Ep. Gal.</sense></entryFree>
stromateus: <entryFree id="n45603" type="main" key="Stro^ma^teus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Strŏmăteus</orth>, <itype>ei</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">strwmateu/s</foreign>. <sense id="n45603.0" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <hi rend="ital">the writer of miscellanies</hi> (<foreign lang="greek">strw/mata</foreign>), <hi rend="ital">a surname of Clemens of Alexandria</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Inst. Div. Litt. 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45603.1" n="II" level="1"> = stromata (v. stroma, II.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 6, p. 696</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
strombus: <entryFree id="n45604" type="greek" key="strombus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strombus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">strombos</foreign>, <sense id="n45604.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of spiral snail</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 10, 39, § 117</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:151" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 11, 53, § 151</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
strongyla: <entryFree id="n45605" type="greek" key="strongy^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strongyla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">stroggu/lh</foreign>, <sense id="n45605.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bust</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 4 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
strongyle: <entryFree id="n45606" type="greek" key="strongy^le_1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strongylē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">stroggu/lh</foreign>, <sense id="n45606.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of alum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 15, 52, § 187</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n45607" type="main" key="Strongy^le_2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Strongylē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*stroggu/lh</foreign>, <sense id="n45607.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of the Lipari islands</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Stromboli</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Or. Mar. 453</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 9, 14, § 93</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:259" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 259</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
strongylion: <entryFree id="n45608" type="main" key="Strongy^li^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Strongylĭon</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*strogguli/wn</foreign>, <sense id="n45608.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Grecian sculptor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 18, § 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stropha: <entryFree id="n45609" type="greek" key="stro^pha"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strŏpha</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">strofh/</foreign>. <sense id="n45609.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A strophe</hi> in the chorus of the Greek and Roman dramas, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 2, 3 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>; Victor. p. 2501 P.—</sense><sense id="n45609.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A trick</hi>, <hi rend="ital">artifice</hi> (not ante-Aug.; and, as in Greek, mostly <number>plur.</number>): <cit><quote lang="la">verbosae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:14:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 14, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 26:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 26, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 37</bibl> prooem.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Ruf. 3, 14 al.</bibl>—<hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego aliquam stropham inveniam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:18:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:7:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 7, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
strophades: <entryFree id="n45610" type="main" key="Stro^pha^des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Strŏphădes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*strofa)des</foreign>, <sense id="n45610.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">two islands lying off the coast of Messenia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at first called Plotœ</hi>, <hi rend="ital">celebrated as the fabled residence of the Harpies</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Strofahia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:10" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 19, § 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:210" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 210</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:709" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 709</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:513" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 513</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
strophiarius: <entryFree id="n45611" type="hapax" key="stro^phi^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strŏphĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>strophium</etym>, <sense id="n45611.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a maker of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dealer in</hi> strophia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:5:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 5, 42</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
strophiolum: <entryFree id="n45612" type="main" key="stro^phi^o^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strŏphĭŏlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n45612.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small wreath</hi> or <hi rend="ital">chaplet</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 2, 2, § 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Cor. Mil. 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
strophium: <entryFree id="n45613" type="greek" key="stro^phi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strŏphĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">stro/fion</foreign> (a band). <sense id="n45613.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A band</hi>, <hi rend="ital">breast-band</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stay</hi>, worn by females under the breasts, Plaut., Turp., Varr., and Cic. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 538, 7 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tereti strophio vincta papillas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a strophio, a psalterio, a flagitio, est factus, repente popularis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:21:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Har. Resp. 21, 44</bibl></cit>; cf.: strophium est fascia brevis, quae virginalem tumorem cohibet papillarum, Non. l. l. —</sense><sense id="n45613.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A head-band</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chaplet</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Copa, 32</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 3, 26</bibl>; esp. of priests; cf. Fest. s. v. stroppus, p. 313 Müll.—</sense><sense id="n45613.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A rope</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ancoralia,</quote> <trans><tr>cables</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 265, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
strophius: <entryFree id="n45614" type="main" key="Stro^phi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Strŏphĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*stro/fios</foreign>, <sense id="n45614.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a king of Phocis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">father of Pylades</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:6:25" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 6, 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
strophoma: <entryFree id="n45615" type="greek" key="stro^pho_ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strŏphōma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">stro/fwma</foreign>, <sense id="n45615.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the bellyache</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gripes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">colic</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Isa. 13, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
strophosus: <entryFree id="n45616" type="main" key="stro^pho_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strŏphōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>strophus</etym>, <sense id="n45616.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that has the gripes</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 3, 57</bibl>; Ven. Carm. 8, 9, 17 (scanned strōphōsus).</sense></entryFree>
strophus: <entryFree id="n45617" type="greek" key="stro^phus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strŏphus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">stro/fos</foreign>, <sense id="n45617.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the bellyache</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gripes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">colic</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 1, 43</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 57</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 26</bibl> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 121" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 121</bibl>, and Fest. s. v. vermina, p. 375 Müll., written as Greek.).</sense></entryFree>
stroppus: <entryFree id="n45618" type="main" key="stroppus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stroppus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. struppus.</entryFree>
structe: <entryFree id="n45619" type="main" key="structe_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">structē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. struo <sense id="n45619.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
structilis: <entryFree id="n45620" type="main" key="structi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">structĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>struo</etym>, <sense id="n45620.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to building; that is built</hi> or <hi rend="ital">constructed; that is designed</hi> or <hi rend="ital">used for building</hi> (postAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">canales,</quote> <trans><tr>walled</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 7</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">cloacae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 9 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">columnae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:5:8" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 8, 5, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bases,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:245" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 50, 16, 245</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:241" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 50, 16, 241</bibl></cit>: <cb n="STRU" /> gemellar, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:52:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 52, 10</bibl>: caementum, <hi rend="ital">building - cement</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">that is used in building</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:76:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 76, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
structio: <entryFree id="n45621" type="main" key="structi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">structĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>struo</etym>, <sense id="n45621.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a joining together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">building</hi>, <hi rend="ital">erecting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">construction</hi> (postclass.). </sense><sense id="n45621.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">SCALARIS,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4570</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">petrosolinum sternes inter spatia structionis (olivarum),</quote> <trans><tr>between the layers of the heap</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Nov. 22, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45621.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: arma venatoribus parabunt, ut retia, venabula, sagittas et quicquid ad structionem ejus studii pertinet, <hi rend="ital">apparatus</hi>, Firm. Math. 8, 9: <cit><quote lang="la">ratio et structio fidei,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pat. 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
structor: <entryFree id="n45622" type="main" key="structor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">structor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n45622.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One who erects a building</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a builder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mason</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carpenter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">res agebatur multis structoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 6, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 14, 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 10, 64, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:6:6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 6, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Ver. 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Heliog. 27 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n45622.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One who spreads the table</hi> or <hi rend="ital">serves up food and carves; a server</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carver</hi> (post-Aug.): ferculorum compositor, Serv. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:703" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 703</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 35, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:48:15" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 48, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:120" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 120</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:136" default="NO">11, 136</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45622.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. p. 365, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
structorius: <entryFree id="n45623" type="hapax" key="structo_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">structōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>structor</etym>, <sense id="n45623.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to building</hi>, <hi rend="ital">architectural</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">operae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
structura: <entryFree id="n45624" type="main" key="structu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">structūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>struo</etym>, <sense id="n45624.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fitting together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adaptation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adjustment.</hi> </sense><sense id="n45624.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n45624.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (post-Aug. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">ossa in manu oblonga omnia et triangula, structurā quādam inter se conectuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 1 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">membranarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 19, 34, § 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">togae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45624.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">an architectural fitting together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a building</hi> or <hi rend="ital">erecting.</hi> </sense><sense id="n45624.4" n="1" level="3"> In abstr. (class.): parietum, <hi rend="ital">the mode of building</hi>, <hi rend="ital">construction</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 9</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">structurae antiquae genus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 11</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">reticulata structura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 22, 51, § 172</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(silex) globosus sed structurae infidelis,</quote> <trans><tr>for building</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 22, 49, § 169</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in structurā saxorum rudium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:27" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 27</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in structuris lapidum impolitorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:63" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 63</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45624.5" n="2" level="3"> In concr., <hi rend="ital">a building</hi>, <hi rend="ital">erection</hi>, <hi rend="ital">edifice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">structure</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 123" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 123</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">subterraneae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 22, 50, § 170</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aerariae structurae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>mining works</tr>, <tr>mines</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 21 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> (al. structuraeque).—</sense><sense id="n45624.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of language, <hi rend="ital">an arrangement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">order</hi>, <hi rend="ital">structure</hi> (in Cic. only as a figure of speech, with quasi or quaedam; <cit><quote lang="la">later in gen.): verborum quasi structura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:8:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 8, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi structura quaedam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:44:149" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 44, 149</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et verborum est structura quaedam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,041:2:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Opt. Gen. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proprietates verborum exigit, et structuram et argumentationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 89:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 89, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mei carminis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:13:4" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 13, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:23" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:5:27" default="NO">8, 5, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:67" default="NO">8, 6, 67</bibl>; 9, 4, 45; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 22 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
structus: <entryFree id="n45625" type="main" key="structus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">structus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, v. struo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n45626" type="main" key="structus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">structus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>struo</etym>, <sense id="n45626.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a heap</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pile</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lignorum structibus incensis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, 15</bibl></cit> Hildeb.</sense></entryFree>
strues: <entryFree id="n45627" type="main" key="stru^es"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strŭes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n45627.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a heap</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pile</hi> of things put together. </sense><sense id="n45627.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: acervus, cumulus, congeries): laterum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 12, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corporum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 70</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 83</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lignorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 11, 22, § 53</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma cum telis in strue mixta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:1:40" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 1, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rogi,</quote> <trans><tr>a funeral pile</tr>, <tr>pyre</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:757" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 757</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Phoen. 112" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Phoen. 112</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Oedip. 33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Oedip. 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">uvarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 4, 5, § 51</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">(milites Macedones) confusa strue implicantur,</quote> <trans><tr>a heap</tr>, <tr>mass</tr>, <tr>phalanx</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:41:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 41, 7</bibl></cit>.—Collect., with a verb in the <number>plur.</number>: LOCVS QVO EA STRVES CONGERANTVR, i. e. <hi rend="ital">piles of wood</hi>, Cenot. Pis. I. (in <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 642</bibl>).—</sense><sense id="n45627.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., in relig. lang., <hi rend="ital">a heap of little offering-cakes</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">strues genera liborum sunt, digitorum conjunctorum non dissimilia, qui superjecta panicula in transversum continentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=310" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 310</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf. id. s. v. ferctum, p. 85; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 134, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">141, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:276" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 276</bibl>; Inscr. Fratr. Arv. ap. Marin. p. 403.</sense></entryFree>
strufertarii: <entryFree id="n45628" type="gloss" key="struferta_ri^i"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strufertārĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n45628.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">they who make offerings near a tree that has been struck by lightning</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">strufertarios dicebant, qui quaedam sacrificia ad arbores fulguritas faciebant, a ferto scilicet, quodam sacrificii genere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=295" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 295</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf. id. s. v. ferctum, p. 85.</sense></entryFree>
struix: <entryFree id="n45629" type="main" key="struix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">struix</orth>, <itype>ĭcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>struo</etym>, <sense id="n45629.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a heap</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pile</hi> of things put together (ante- and post-class. for the class. strues). </sense><sense id="n45629.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">struices antiqui dicebant exstructiones omnium rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=310" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 310</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">tantas struices concinnat patinarias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 1, 26</bibl></cit>: et <cb n="STRU" /> Livius: <cit><quote lang="la">per struices saxeas lapsu accidit, Livius ap. Fest. l. l.: lignorum struicibus incensis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, 222</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caementiciae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 28</bibl></cit>. —* </sense><sense id="n45629.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: struix malorum, Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 4, 267</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 64 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
struma: <entryFree id="n45630" type="main" key="stru_ma1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strūma</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>struo</etym>, <sense id="n45630.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a scrofulous tumor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">struma</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:28:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 28, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 9</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:206" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 51, 77, § 206</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:38" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 14, 16, § 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:26 al" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 5, 14, § 26 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui exsecant pestem aliquam, tamquam strumam civitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:65:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 65, 135</bibl></cit>; cf. sarcastically: Vatinii strumam sacerdotii <foreign lang="greek">diba/fw|</foreign> vestiant, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 9, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n45631" type="main" key="Stru_ma2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Strūma</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. struma</etym>, <sense id="n45631.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:52:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 52, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 6, 21, § 81</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
strumaticus: <entryFree id="n45632" type="hapax" key="stru_ma_ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strūmātĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n45632.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having a struma</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scrofulous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strumous</hi>, Firm. Math. 8, 19 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
strumea: <entryFree id="n45633" type="main" key="stru_me^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strūmĕa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. herba) [id.], <sense id="n45633.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an herb that cures the struma</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 13, 109, § 174</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
strumella: <entryFree id="n45634" type="hapax" key="stru_mella"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strūmella</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n45634.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small struma</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 15 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
strumentum: <entryFree id="n45635" type="main" key="stru_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strūmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = instrumentum, aeternitatis, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> ad Uxor. 1, 7</bibl>.</entryFree>
strumosus: <entryFree id="n45636" type="main" key="stru_mo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strūmōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. struma</etym>, <sense id="n45636.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having a struma</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scrofulous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strumous</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:10:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 10, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:309" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 309</bibl></cit>: facies, Schol. Bob. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:chapter=65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 65</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
strumus: <entryFree id="n45637" type="main" key="stru_mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strūmus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n45637.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant that cures the struma</hi>, called also strychnos and cuculus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 8, 44, § 68</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 74</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
struo: <entryFree id="n45638" type="main" key="stru^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strŭo</orth>, <itype>xi, ctum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>root <foreign lang="greek">stor</foreign>; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">strw/nnumi</foreign>, to spread; cf. Sanscr. upa-star, to make ready; and v. sterno</etym>, <sense id="n45638.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to place by</hi> or <hi rend="ital">upon each other; to pile up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arrange</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n45638.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n45638.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (rare but class.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">condo, compono): quasi structa et nexa verbis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:41:140" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 41, 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lateres, qui super musculo struantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">altaque congestos struxisse ad sidera montes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 153</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbores in pyram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:9:231" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 231</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frugem ordine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:15:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 15, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">avenas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:677" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 677</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ordine longo penum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:704" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 704</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:279" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 11, 279</bibl>; hence, <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, transf.: <cit><quote lang="la">altaria donis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acervum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">congeriem armorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opes, rem,</quote> <trans><tr>to heap up</tr>, <tr>accumulate</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 120, 85</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:2:44" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 2, 44</bibl>: PEDEM, <hi rend="ital">to heap up steps</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to flee</hi>: SI CALVITVR PEDEMVE STRVIT MANVM ENDOIACITO, Fragm. XII. Tab. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:313" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> 313</bibl> Müll.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: aliae (apes) struunt, aliae poliunt, aliae suggerunt, <hi rend="ital">pile up</hi> (the comb), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 10, 10, § 22</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n45638.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n45638.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To make by joining together; to build</hi>, <hi rend="ital">erect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fabricate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make</hi>, <hi rend="ital">form</hi>, <hi rend="ital">construct</hi> (syn. aedifico): <cit><quote lang="la">fornacem bene struito ... lateribus summam (fornacem) struito,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 38, 1</bibl></cit> and 3: per speluncas saxis structas, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:16:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 16, 37</bibl> (Trag. Rel. p. 208 Rib.); imitated by <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 195</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">templa saxo structa vetusto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moenia saxo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:573" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 573</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moenia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:811" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 811</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:18:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 18, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pyras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:204" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 204</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingentem pyram,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 215</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:240" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 240</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">navem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:295" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 295</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tubas,</quote> <trans><tr>to make</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 3, 20: <cit><quote lang="la">cubilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:841" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 841</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">convivia,</quote> <trans><tr>to get ready</tr>, <tr>prepare</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 37</bibl></cit> et saep.— <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">reticulata structura, quā frequentissime Romae struunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 22, 51, § 172</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Part. perf.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxorum structa,</quote> <trans><tr>masonry</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:361" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 361</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45638.5" n="2" level="3"> With the idea of order predominating, <hi rend="ital">to set in order</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arrange</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">copias ante frontem castrorum struit,</quote> <trans><tr>arranges</tr>, <tr>draws up in rank and file</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 37</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">aciem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:8" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 42</bibl>: omnes armatos in campo, Liv 42, 51.—</sense><sense id="n45638.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n45638.7" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to join together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">compound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">compose</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex praepositione et duobus vocabulis dure videtur struxisse Pacuvius, Nerei repandirostrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:67" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 67</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45638.8" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n45638.9" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To prepare</hi> something detrimental; <hi rend="ital">to cause</hi>, <hi rend="ital">occasion; to devise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contrive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">instigate</hi>, etc. (very freq., esp. in Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">struunt sorores Atticae dirum nefas, Poët. ap. Mar. Vict. p. 2596 P. (Trag.
