Rel. p. 272 Rib.): aliquid calamitatis struere et moliri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:64:178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 64, 178</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sycophantias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 1, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">num me fefellit hosce id struere?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sollicitudinem sibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 21, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odium in alios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:51:208" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 51, 208</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insidias alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilia recuperandi regni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 65 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:198" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 198</bibl>: periculum ruinae, Caecin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 7, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pericula alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 10:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 10, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortem alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crimina et accusatores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 12</bibl></cit>; cf.: ultroque struebantur qui monerent perfugere ad Germaniae exercilus,<pb n="1768" /> <cb n="STUB" />  <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 67</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">controversiam de nomine,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 28, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid struit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:235" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 235</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid struis?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 271</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 3, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45638.10" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To order</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arrange</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dispose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">regulate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem domi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 6, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:43:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 43, 171</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bene structa collocatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:70:232" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 70, 232</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:10:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 10, 7</bibl></cit>: orationem solutam, Prob. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:20:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 20, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum proxima dicimus, struere ulteriora possimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 7, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid parum structum (in oratione),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 100:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 100, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum varios struerem per saecula reges,</quote> <trans><tr>ordained</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:535" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 535</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45638.11" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To fit out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">provide with</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">quot steriles utriusque naturae infructuosis genitalibus structi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res. Carn. 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermo autem spiritu structus est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> adv. Prax. 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Verg. Vel. 9</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">structē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">orderly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">regularly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">methodically</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">historiam scripsere Sallustius structe, Pictor incondite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Ep. ad Ver. 1" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Ep. ad Ver. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae nobis causa est structius prodeundi?</quote> <trans><tr>with more embellishment</tr>, <tr>more ornately</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Cult. Fem. 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
struppearia: <entryFree id="n45639" type="gloss" key="struppe^a_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">struppĕārĭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, v. struppus.</entryFree>
struppus: <entryFree id="n45640" type="main" key="struppus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">struppus</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">stroppus</orth>; <sense id="n45640.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the foll.</ref></xr>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">stro/fion</foreign></etym>, <hi rend="ital">a band</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thong</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strap</hi> (anteclass.): remos jussit religare struppis, Liv. And. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 19, 4, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 3, 6</bibl>: struppis verberari, Gracch. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:3:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 3, 5</bibl>: stroppus est, ut Ateius Philologus existimat, quod Graece <foreign lang="greek">stro/fion</foreign> vocatur, et quod sacerdotes pro insigni habent in capite. Quidam coronam esse dicunt, aut quod pro coronā insigne in caput imponatur, quale sit strophium. Itaque apud Faliscos diem festum esse, qui vocetur struppearia, quia coronati ambulent; <cit><quote lang="la">et a Tusculanis, quod in pulvinari imponatur Castoris, struppum vocari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=313" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 313</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tenuioribus (coronis) utebantur antiqui, stroppos appellantes: unde nata strophiola,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 2, 2, § 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
strutheus: <entryFree id="n45641" type="greek" key="stru_the^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strūthĕus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">strūthĭus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">strou/qios</foreign>, <sense id="n45641.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to sparrows</hi>: mala (<hi rend="ital">sparrow-apples</hi>), a particular kind of apples, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 11, 10, § 38</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 7, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 1, 3, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:10:19" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 10, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">strutheum in mimis praecipue vocant obscenam partem virilem, a salacitate videlicet passeris, qui Graece struthos dicitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=313" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 313</bibl></cit> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
struthio: <entryFree id="n45642" type="main" key="stru_thi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strūthĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, v. struthiocamelus.</entryFree>
struthiocamelinus: <entryFree id="n45643" type="greek" key="stru_thi^o^ca^me_li^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strūthĭŏcămēlĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">strouqiokamh/linos</foreign>, <sense id="n45643.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to an ostrich</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sevum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 5, 30, § 96</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
struthiocamelus: <entryFree id="n45644" type="greek" key="stru_thi^o^ca^me_lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strūthĭŏcămēlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (<gen>f.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 56, § 155</bibl>), = <foreign lang="greek">strouqioka/mhlos</foreign>, <sense id="n45644.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an ostrich</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 1, 1, § 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:56" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 22, 29, § 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:130" default="NO" valid="yes">11, 37, 47, § 130</bibl> (Jahn, struthocamelus); <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 137, 5 al.</bibl>—By later writers also called simply <orth extent="full" lang="la">strūthĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">strouqi/wn</foreign>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Gord. 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Heliog. 30</bibl>; Vopisc. Firm. 6; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:11:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Lev. 11, 16</bibl> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
struthion: <entryFree id="n45645" type="greek" key="struthi^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">struthĭon</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">strouqi/on</foreign>, <sense id="n45645.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">soapwort</hi>: Saponaria officinalis, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 3, 18, § 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:96 al" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 11, 58, § 96 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
struthopus: <entryFree id="n45646" type="main" key="stru_tho^pu_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strūthŏpūs</orth>, <itype>pŏdis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">strouqo/pous</foreign>, <sense id="n45646.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sparrow-footed</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">having small feet</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 2, 2, § 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
strychnos: <entryFree id="n45647" type="greek" key="strychnos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">strychnos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">stru/xnos</foreign>, <sense id="n45647.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of nightshade</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 8, 44, § 68</bibl>.—Called also <orth extent="full" lang="la">trychnos</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 31, 105, § 177</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 74</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
strymon: <entryFree id="n45648" type="main" key="Stry_mon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Strȳmon</orth> (<case>nom.</case> Strymo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1 praef" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 1 praef.</bibl> <sense id="n45648.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">med.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 10, 17, § 38</bibl>), ŏnis and ŏnos (<case>acc.</case> Strymona, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,005:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Cim. 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 10, 12, § 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Strymonem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:44:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 44, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:29" default="NO" valid="yes">45, 29</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*strumw/n</foreign>. </sense><sense id="n45648.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The river Strymon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Macedonia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the borders of Thrace</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Struma</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Kara-su</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:2:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 2, 2</bibl> and 9; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 10, 17, § 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:27" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 10, 12, § 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:508" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 508</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:257" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 257</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:44:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 44, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 4, 72 al.—Many cranes lived upon its banks, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:199" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 199</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> B. Gild. 476</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45648.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">Thrace</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:188" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 188</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n45648.3" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Strȳmŏnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Strymon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Strymonian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">grues,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 120</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:265" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 10, 265</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">also called grex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:30:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 30, 8</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">Thracian</hi> or <hi rend="ital">northern</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">matres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:602" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 602</bibl></cit>: Arctos. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:526" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 526</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aquilo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Agam. 479" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Agam. 479</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45648.4" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Strȳ-mŏnis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj. f.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Thrace; subst.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a Thracian woman</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qualis Strymonis abscisso fertur aperta sinu,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Amazon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 4, 72.</sense></entryFree>
stubera: <entryFree id="n45649" type="main" key="Stubera"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Stubera</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n45649.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in Macedonia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:18" default="NO" valid="yes">43, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:19" default="NO" valid="yes">43, 19</bibl>. <cb n="STUD" /></sense></entryFree>
studeo: <entryFree id="n45650" type="main" key="stu^de^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stŭdĕo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, 2</itype> (<sense id="n45650.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> studīvi, M. Aur. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Ep. ad M. Caes. 5" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Ep. ad M. Caes. 5</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>perh. kindr. with <foreign lang="greek">speu/dw, spoudh/</foreign>, to speed, haste</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to be eager</hi> or <hi rend="ital">zealous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to take pains about</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be diligent in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">anxious about</hi>, <hi rend="ital">busy one's self with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strive after</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to apply one's self to</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pursue</hi> some course of action, etc.; <hi rend="ital">to desire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wish</hi>, etc. (very freq. and class.; cf.: operam do). </sense><sense id="n45650.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n45650.2" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg> (very rare), Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:10:12" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 10, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut aequum fuerat atque ut studui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 2, 31</bibl></cit>: si qui in eā re studebat, etc., Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:2:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 2, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45650.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> (rare; mostly with <hi rend="ital">neutr. pronn.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">adjj.</hi>): horum ille nihil egregie Studebat; <cit><quote lang="la">et tamen omnia haec mediocriter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eadem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:2:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud ipsum, quod studet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:2:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perspexi ex tuis litteris, quod semper studui, me a te plurimi fieri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:31:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 31, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lenonem perjurum ut perdas id studes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:1:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 1, 72</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">id, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id, ne, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:56:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 56, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unum studetis Antonii conatum avertere a re publicā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:6:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 6, 7, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc unum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 120</bibl></cit>.—With a <hi rend="ital">defin. obj.</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">minus has res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:5:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 5, 44</bibl></cit>: res Graecas, Titin. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 629</bibl> P.—</sense><sense id="n45650.4" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> or <case>acc.</case> with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> (freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">si merito meo referre studeant gratias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verum audire ex te studeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 5, 2, 42</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">de quo studeo ex te audire quod sentias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:11:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 11, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scire studeo, quid egeris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:20:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 13, 20, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">studemus, nostris consiliis tutiorem vitam hominum reddere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:2:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fieri studebam ejus prudentiā doctior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hanc acerbitate opprimere studuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Dion, 6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dion, 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">portum intrare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Chabr. 4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Chabr. 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego me id facere studeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 1, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quisquam est, qui placere se studeat bonis Quam plurimis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:prol. 1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. prol. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illis gratum se videri studet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:20:70" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 20, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te sociam studeo scribendis versibus esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes homines, qui sese student praestare ceteris animalibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque est, cur nunc studeam, has nuptias mutarier,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:1:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 1, 51</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">rem ad arma deduci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 4</bibl></cit>; Matt. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:28:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 28, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45650.5" n="(d)" level="5"> With <case>dat.</case> (so most freq. in prose and poetry): <cit><quote lang="la">somno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illi rei studet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:3:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 1, 3, 30</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">huic rei studendum, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iisdem rebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frustra aut pecuniae, aut imperiis, aut opibus, aut gloriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:18:60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 18, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeturae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:11:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 11, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtuti, laudi, dignitati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:24:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 24, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">novis rebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">agriculturae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 22</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">6, 29: sacrificiis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litteris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:93:322" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 93, 322</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui scientiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui arti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medicinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">commodis communibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:8:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 8, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:10:19" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 10, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lectis sternendis studuimus munditiisque apparandis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 5, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">armamentis complicandis et componendis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:2:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 1, 2, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patrimonio augendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:55:225" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 55, 225</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juri et legibus cognoscendis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:5:3:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 5, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">revocandis regibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:9:5" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 9, 5</bibl></cit>.—* (<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: parens, qui te nec amet nec studeat tui, <hi rend="ital">troubles himself about you</hi>, Caecil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:29:72" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 29, 72</bibl> (Com. Rel. v. 201 Rib.).— (<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">Caesar maxime studebat, ut partem oppidi excluderet, Auct. B. Alex. 1, 4: ut habeas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:10:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 43, 10, 1</bibl>; cf. with <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne solus esset, studui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 2</bibl></cit>, epil. 6: <cit><quote lang="la">ne sint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:10:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 43, 10, 1</bibl></cit>.— (<foreign lang="greek">h</foreign>) <hi rend="ital">In aliquid</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">in quam rem studendum sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:6:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 6, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quidam pictores in id solum student, ut sciant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 2, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45650.6" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n45650.7" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To be zealous</hi> for any one, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to be friendly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attached</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">favorable</hi> to one, <hi rend="ital">to favor</hi> him (syn. favere). </sense><sense id="n45650.8" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut studeat tibi, ut te adjuvet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:36:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 36, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homini nequam atque improbo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Catilinae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui (with favere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:2:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 2, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus (partibus) illi student,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 27, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nonnullae civitates rebus Cassii studebant, Auct. B. Alex. 62, 2: rebus Atheniensium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,006:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Lys. 1 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">petitioni alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:69" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 69</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45650.9" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque studere neque odisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 51:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 51, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45650.10" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To apply one's self to learning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to study</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be diligent</hi> in study (only post-Aug.; for which in Cic. litteris, arti, etc.; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">supra</ref></xr>, I. A. <foreign lang="greek">d</foreign>): <cit><quote lang="la">computamus annos, non quibus studuimus, sed quibus viximus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:11:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 11, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:7:1" default="NO">2, 7, 1</bibl>: Demosthenes diligenter apud Andronicum studuit. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 7</bibl>: aliquem a proposito studendi fugare, id. <cb n="STUD" /> 2, 2, 7: non est, quod post cibum studeas. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 94:20" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 94, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">duo, qui apud Chaldaeos studuisse se dicunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 7:4:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Q. N. 7, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">negat enim te studere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 13, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">studes an piscaris?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 2:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 8, 1</bibl></cit>; 2, 13, 5; <cit><quote lang="la">5, 5, 18: solacium studendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:61" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">videtur mihi inter Menenios et Appios studuisse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 21</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 32</bibl>; 34.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">stŭ-dens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a diligent student</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in habitu studentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 5, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
studiolum: <entryFree id="n45651" type="main" key="stu^di^o^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stŭdĭŏlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>studium</etym>. * <sense id="n45651.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A little study</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a little piece of composition</hi>, M. Aurel. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Ep. ad M. Caes. 5" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Ep. ad M. Caes. 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45651.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A little study</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">a little room</hi> or <hi rend="ital">closet to study in</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Murat.</author> 937, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
studiose: <entryFree id="n45652" type="main" key="stu^di^o_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stŭdĭōsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. studiosus <sense id="n45652.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
studiosus: <entryFree id="n45653" type="main" key="stu^di^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stŭdĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>studium</etym>, <sense id="n45653.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">eager</hi>, <hi rend="ital">zealous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assiduous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">anxious</hi> after any thing, <hi rend="ital">fond</hi> or <hi rend="ital">studious</hi> of any thing. </sense><sense id="n45653.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n45653.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> (most freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">venandi aut pilae studiosi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:20:74" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 20, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemorum caedisque ferinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:675" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 675</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">placendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:423" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 3, 423</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">culinae aut Veneris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">florum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:27:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 27, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:59:251" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 59, 251</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:13:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 13, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eloquentiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:122" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 10, 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summe omnium doctrinarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">musices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapientiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3</bibl></cit>, prooem. § 2; <cit><quote lang="la">12, 1, 19: sermonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:114" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juris,</quote> <trans><tr>occupied with</tr>, <tr>studious of</tr>, <tr>the law</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:32" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 32</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille restituendi mei quam retinendi studiosior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 3, 3</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">munditiarum lautitiarumque studiosissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:46" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aleae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Epit. 1" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Epit. 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45653.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi adulterio, studiosus rei nulli aliae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:206" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 206</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">armorum quam conviviorum apparatibus studiosior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:8:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 9, 8, 4</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n45653.4" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">studiosiores ad opus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:17:7" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 17, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45653.5" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in argento,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 52, 1</bibl></cit>.— (<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo valde studiosus ac diligens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 31, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">putavi mihi suscipiendum laborem utilem studiosis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,041:5:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Opt. Gen. 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid studioso animo inchoare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:16:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 16, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45653.6" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n45653.7" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Zealous</hi> for any one, i. e. <hi rend="ital">partial</hi>, <hi rend="ital">friendly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attached</hi>, <hi rend="ital">devoted</hi> to him (class.; esp. freq. in Cic.): omnem omnibus studiosis ac fautoribus illius victoriae <foreign lang="greek">parrhsi/an</foreign> eripui, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:16:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 16, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mei studiosos habeo Dyrrhachinos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 22, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:16:64" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 16, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nobilitatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 40, 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">studiosa Pectora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:10:91" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 10, 91</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">studiosior alterius partis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 11 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te studiosiorem in me colendo fore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:19:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 19, 1</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc cum ejus studiosissimo Pammene,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:30:105" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 30, 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">existimationis meae studiosissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:47:section=117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 47, § 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">studiosissimum Platonis auditorem fuisse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 32</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45653.8" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Devoted to study</hi> or <hi rend="ital">learning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">learned</hi>, <hi rend="ital">studious</hi> (not anteAug.; in Cic. always with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: litterarum, doctrinarum, etc.; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">supra</ref></xr>, I. <foreign lang="greek">a</foreign>, and cf. studeo, II. B.): <cit><quote lang="la">quid studiosa cohors operum struit?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse est studiosus, litteratus, etiam disertus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:26:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 26, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenis studiosus alioquin,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:32" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 3, 32</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things: <cit><quote lang="la">studiosa disputatio,</quote> <trans><tr>a learned disputation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:70" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">otium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:22:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 22, 11</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">stŭdĭōsi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">studious men</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the learned</hi>, <hi rend="ital">students</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,041:5:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Opt. Gen. 5, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:10:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 10, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:45" default="NO">10, 1, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:13:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 13, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:28:2" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 28, 2</bibl>.—Also, <number>sing.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Stŭdĭōsus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">The Student</hi>, the title of a work of the elder Pliny, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 5, 5</bibl>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">stŭ-dĭōsē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">eagerly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">zealously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">anxiously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carefully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">studiously</hi> (freq. and class.): <cit><quote lang="la">texentem telam studiose offendimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum studiose pila luderet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:62:253" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 62, 253</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libenter studioseque audire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:12:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 12, 39</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid studiose diligenterque curare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 16</bibl></cit>, A, § <cit><quote lang="la">7: studiose discunt, diligenter docentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid investigare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:11:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 11, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">studiose cavendum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:26:99" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 26, 99</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego cum antea studiose commendabam Marcilium, tum multo nunc studiosius, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 54</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:1:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 1, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:61" default="NO">3, 6, 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:578" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 578</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Ages. 3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ages. 3, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:11:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 11, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:3:5 al" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 43, 3, 5 al.</bibl>—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid studiosissime quaerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:10:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 10, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:28:101" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 28, 101</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:26:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 26, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:54" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 45</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
studium: <entryFree id="n45654" type="main" key="stu^di^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stŭdĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>studeo</etym>, <sense id="n45654.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a busying one's self about</hi> or <hi rend="ital">application to</hi> a thing; <hi rend="ital">assiduity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">zeal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eagerness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fondness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inclination</hi>, <hi rend="ital">desire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exertion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">endeavor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">study</hi>: stu <pb n="1769" /> <cb n="STUD" /> dium est animi assidua et vehemens ad aliquam rem applicata magnā cum voluntate occupatio, ut philosophiae, poëticae, geometriae, litterarum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:25:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 25, 36</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n45654.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n45654.2" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 900</bibl> P. (Praecepta, v. 4 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">tantum studium tamque multam operam in aliquā re ponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid curare studio maximo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:3:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 3, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem retrahere ab studio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:prol. 2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. prol. 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">studium semper assit, cunctatio absit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:13:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 13, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid summo studio curāque discere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 3, 3</bibl></cit>; so (with cura, industria, labor, diligentia, etc.) <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 6, 3</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">10, 1, 3: alacritate ac studio uti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">studio incendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:17:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 17, 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:1:section=1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 1, § 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">suo quisque studio maxime ducitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:2:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 2, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quot capitum vivunt, totidem studiorum Milia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 1, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 3, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt pueritiae certa studia, sunt ineuntis adulescentiae ... sunt extrema quaedam studia senectutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:20:76" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 20, 76</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">non studio accusare sed officio defendere,</quote> <trans><tr>with zeal</tr>, <tr>from inclination</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:32:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 32, 91</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">laedere gaudes, et hoc studio pravus facis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 79</bibl></cit>.—In late Lat. studio often means simply <hi rend="ital">voluntarily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on purpose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intentionally</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non studio sed fortuitu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:40:5:13" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 40, 5, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45654.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: studiumque iteris reprime, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 485, 8</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 627 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">in pugnae studio quod dedita mens est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:647" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 647</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Carthaginienses ad studium fallendi studio quaestus vocabantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:35:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 35, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">efferor studio patres vestros videndi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:23:83" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 23, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid ego de studiis dicam cognoscendi semper aliquid atque discendi?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:27:104" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 27, 104</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">discendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:8:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 8, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 22, 36 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">doctrinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:16:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 16, 46</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 1, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scribendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scribendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:13:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 13, 5</bibl></cit>: vitae studium, <hi rend="ital">way of life</hi>, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 498, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">studium armorum a manibus ad oculos translatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:13:5" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 13, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45654.4" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi> (usu. to avoid multiplying genitives): <cit><quote lang="la">ea res studia hominum adcendit ad consulatum mandandum Ciceroni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 23:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 23, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">studium ad frugalitatem multitudines provocavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:20:4:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 20, 4, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45654.5" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n45654.6" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Zeal</hi> for any one; <hi rend="ital">good-will</hi>, <hi rend="ital">affection</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attachment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">devotion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">favor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">kindness</hi>, etc. (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">officium, favor): tibi profiteor atque polliceor eximium et singulare meum studium in omni genere officii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 8, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">studium et favor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:10:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 10, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">studio ac suffragio suo viam sibi ad beneficium impetrandum munire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 7, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pompeius significat studium erga me non mediocre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:19:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 19, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suum infelix erga populum Romanum studium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:56:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 56, 9</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">omne suum erga meam dignitatem studium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:56:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 56, 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">studium in aliquem habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:34:104" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 34, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gaditani ab omni studio sensuque Poenorum mentes suas ad nostrum imperium nomenque flexerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:17:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 17, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">studium suum in rempublicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 49:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 49, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">studium in populum Romanum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">studiis odiisque carens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:377" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 377</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">putabatur et Marius studia volgi amissurus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 84:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 84, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid studio partium facere,</quote> <trans><tr>party spirit</tr>, <tr>partisanship</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:13:section=35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 13, § 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">for which simply studium: quo minus cupiditatis ac studii visa est oratio habere, eo plus auctoritatis habuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatus, in quo ipso erant studia,</quote> <trans><tr>party efforts</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ultio senatum in studia diduxerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45654.7" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Application to learning</hi> or <hi rend="ital">studying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">study;</hi> in the <number>plur.</number>, <hi rend="ital">studies</hi> (very freq.; also in Cic.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">studeo and studiosus): pabulum studii atque doctrinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:14:49" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 14, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(eum) non solum naturā et moribus, verum etiam studio et doctrinā esse sapientem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semper mihi et doctrina et eruditi homines et tua ista studia placuerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:17:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 17, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">studia exercere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">studia Graecorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:18:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 18, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illum se et hominibus Pythagoreis et studiis illis dedisse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 10, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">relinque te studiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 9, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">studia ad voluptatem exercere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 6:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 8, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">famam ex studiis petere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 6:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 11, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Polyb. 18" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. ad Polyb. 18</bibl> (36), 1: studia graviora iracundis omittenda sunt, id. Ira, 3, 9, 1; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">studiis annos septem dedit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si non Intendes animum studiis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2</bibl></cit>, <cb n="STUL" /> 36: o seri studiorum! i. e. <foreign lang="greek">o)yimaqei=s</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 10, 21</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n45654.8" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n45654.9" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">The fruits of study</hi>, <hi rend="ital">works</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">flagitante vulgo ut omnia sua studia publicaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45654.10" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">A place for study</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a study</hi>, <hi rend="ital">school</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">philosophum (se egit) in omnibus studiis, templis, locis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> M. Aurel. 26</bibl></cit>; Cod. Th. 14, 9, 3.</sense></entryFree>
stulte: <entryFree id="n45655" type="main" key="stulte_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stultē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. stultus <sense id="n45655.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
stultifico: <entryFree id="n45656" type="main" key="stulti^fi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stultĭfĭco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>stultus-facio</etym>, <sense id="n45656.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to turn into foolishness</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Orig. in Jer. Hom. 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
stultiloquentia: <entryFree id="n45657" type="hapax" key="stulti^lo^quenti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stultĭlŏquentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>stultiloquus</etym>, <sense id="n45657.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">silly talk</hi>, <hi rend="ital">babbling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stultiloquence</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 185</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stultiloquium: <entryFree id="n45658" type="hapax" key="stulti^lo^qui^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stultĭlŏquĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n45658.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">silly talk</hi>, <hi rend="ital">babbling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stultiloquy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 3, 25</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Eph. 5, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,010:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Eph. 5, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stultiloquus: <entryFree id="n45659" type="main" key="stulti^lo^quus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stultĭlŏquus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>stultusloquor</etym>, <sense id="n45659.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">talking foolishly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">babbling</hi> (anteand post-class. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">tace stultiloque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:3:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 3, 45</bibl></cit>: ignoratio, Hilar. Trin. 10, 65.</sense></entryFree>
stultitia: <entryFree id="n45660" type="main" key="stulti^ti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stultĭtĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>stultus</etym>, <sense id="n45660.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">folly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">foolishness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">simplicity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">silliness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fatuity</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">delirationem incredibilem! Non enim omnis error stultitia dicenda est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:43:90" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 43, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stultitia atque insipientia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inscitiae meae et stultitiae ignoscas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 6, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utrum stultitiā facere ego hunc an malitiā Dicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:3:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 4, 3, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stultitiā ac temeritate vestrā Galliam prosternere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:7:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 7, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stultitia loquax,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:35:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 35, 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">num tibi aut stultitia accessit aut superat superbia?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stultitia atque arrogantia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8</bibl></cit>, prooem. § <cit><quote lang="la">3: stultitia est, ei te esse tristem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 4, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:3:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 3, 3, 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:2:82 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 1, 2, 82 al.</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">esse enim stultitiam nolle sumere, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:34:84" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 34, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est proprium stultitiae aliorum vitia cernere, oblivisci suorum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:30:73" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 30, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hujus istius facti stultitiam alia jam superior stultitia defendit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:9:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Post. 9, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stultitiae peccatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:37:124 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 37, 124 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stultitiamque meum crimen debere vocari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:6:35" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 6, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meae Stultitiam patiuntur opes,</quote> <trans><tr>extravagance</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 29</bibl></cit>.—Esp. of <hi rend="ital">folly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">weakness</hi>, etc., in love: <cit><quote lang="la">supplicatum venio ob stultitiam meam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:10:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 10, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stultitiae adulescentiae ejus ignoscas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:5:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 5, 2, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 106</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 2, 8</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominum ineptias ac stultitias, quae devorandae nobis sunt, non ferebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:67:236" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 67, 236</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
stultividus: <entryFree id="n45661" type="hapax" key="stulti^vi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stultĭvĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>stultusvideo</etym>, <sense id="n45661.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">simple-sighted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that sees things in a foolish light</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:3:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 3, 64</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stultus: <entryFree id="n45662" type="main" key="stultus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stultus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>root star-; v. stolidus</etym>, <sense id="n45662.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">foolish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">simple</hi>, <hi rend="ital">silly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fatuous</hi>, etc. (cf.: insulsus, ineptus, insipiens, brutus). </sense><sense id="n45662.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">stulti, stolidi, fatui, fungi, bardi, blenni, buccones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 5, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 1, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inepte stultus es,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:2:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 2, 2, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulier stulta atque inscita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:3:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 2, 3, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex stultis insanos facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 23</bibl></cit>: deum qui non summum putet, stultum (existumat), Caecil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:32:68" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 32, 68</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego vero te non stultum ut saepe, non improbum, ut semper, sed dementem et insanum, rebus vincam necessariis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:4:1:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 4, 1, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">o stultos Camillos, Curios, Fabricios!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:24:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 24, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auditor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 6, 13</bibl></cit>: stultus est, qui cupida cupiens cupienter cupit, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 91, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sicut ego feci stultus! contrivi diem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 3, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut vel non stultus quasi stulte cum sale dicat aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:68:274" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 68, 274</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos ait Caecilius comicos, stultos senes, hos significat credulos, obliviosos, dissolutos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:11:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 11, 36</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:26:100" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 26, 100</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi sis stultior stultissimo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 3, 2, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stultior stulto fuisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 4, 3, 19</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">stultus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a fool</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">stulto intellegens quid interest!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 4, 7, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">stultorum plena sunt omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:22:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 22, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lux stultorum festa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:513" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 513</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">stultorum feriae appellabantur Quirinalia, quod eo die sacrificabant hi, qui solenni die aut non potuerunt rem divinam facere aut ignoraverunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=316" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 316</bibl></cit> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n45662.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things concrete and abstract: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla est tam stulta civitas, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:18:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 18, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stultā ac barbarā arrogantiā elati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cogitationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:10:4" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 10, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laetitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 51:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 51, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">levitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:5:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 5, 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cb n="STUP" /> gloria, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:17:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 17, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>foolishly spent</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:4:34" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 4, 34</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">vita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 15:10" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 15, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:746" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 746</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilium stultissimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:23:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 23, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:16:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 16, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:86:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 86, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod cavere possis, stultum admittere est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:6:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 6, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid autem stultius quam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:15:55" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 15, 55</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:8:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Post. 8, 22</bibl> (v. in the foll.).—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">stultē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">foolishly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sillily</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">stulte facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dupliciter stulte dicunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:section=45" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, § 45</bibl></cit> M¨ll.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid stultius, quam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:8:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Post. 8, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stultius atque intemperantius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:13:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 13, 14</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec et dicuntur et creduntur stultissime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:28:70" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 28, 70</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
stupa: <entryFree id="n45663" type="main" key="stu_pa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stūpa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. stuppa.</entryFree>
stupefacio: <entryFree id="n45664" type="main" key="stu^pe^fa^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stŭpĕ-făcĭo</orth>, <itype>fēci, factum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>stupeo</etym>, <sense id="n45664.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make stupid</hi> or <hi rend="ital">senseless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to benumb</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deaden</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stun</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stupefy</hi> (rare; usu. in the <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>). </sense><sense id="n45664.1" n="(a)" level="5"> In <hi rend="ital">verb. fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">privatos luctus stupefecit publicus pavor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 39</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:9:122" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 9, 122</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut nostro stupefiat Cynthia versu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:13" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 13</bibl></cit> (3, 4), 7.—</sense><sense id="n45664.2" n="(b)" level="5"> In <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stupefied</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stunned</hi>: quem stupefacti dicentem intuentur? * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:14:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 14, 53</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">spectas tuam stupefacta figuram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:14:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 14, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenti motu stupefactus aquarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:365" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 365</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Thyest. 547" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Thyest. 547</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:633" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 633</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:228" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 228</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stupefio: <entryFree id="n45665" type="main" key="stu^pe^fi_o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stŭpĕfīo</orth>, <itype>factus</itype>, v. stupefacio.</entryFree>
stupeo: <entryFree id="n45666" type="main" key="stu^peo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stŭpeo</orth>, <itype>ui, ēre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n45666.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [Sanscr. stūpas, cumulus; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">stu/pos</foreign>; Lat. stipes, a block, stump; cf. <foreign lang="greek">stei/bw</foreign>]. </sense><sense id="n45666.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be struck senseless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be stunned</hi>, <hi rend="ital">benumbed; to be struck aghast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be astonished</hi>, <hi rend="ital">astounded</hi>, <hi rend="ital">amazed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">confounded</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stupefied</hi>, etc. (freq. and class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. torpeo): animus lassus curā confectus stupet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum hic etiam tum semisomnus, stupri plenus stuperet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:36:section=95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 36, § 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">torpescunt scorpiones aconiti tactu stupentque pallentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 2, 2, § 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec cum loqueris, nos barones stupemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:23:77" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 23, 77</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quae cum intuerer stupens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:18:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 18, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum stupet obtutuque haeret defixus in uno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:495" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 495</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">admiror, stupeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:63:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 63, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adhuc in oppidis coartatus et stupens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vigiles attoniti et stupentibus similes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:2:3" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 2, 3</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribuni capti et stupentes animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 38</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45666.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case> or <hi rend="ital">in</hi> with <case>abl.</case>: stupere gaudio Graecus, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:58" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 58</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exspectatione stupere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:13:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 13, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">novitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:6:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carminibus stupens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:13:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 13, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stupet Albius aere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 4, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laetitiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 621" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc.
