Fur. 621</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rex subito malo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:12" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui stupet in titulis et imaginibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stupet in Turno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:446" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 446</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n45666.3" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mater ad auditas stupuit voces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:509" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 509</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et stupet ad raptus Tyndaris ipsa tuos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:52:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 52, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad supervacua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 87:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 87, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad tam saevam dominationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:26:1:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 26, 1, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45666.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of inanimate or abstract things, <hi rend="ital">to be benumbed</hi> or <hi rend="ital">stiffened</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be brought to a stand-still</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to stop</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic.): multum refert, a fonte bibatur Qui fluit, an pigro quae stupet unda lacu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:100:10" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 100, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flumina brumā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:603" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 603</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">undae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 763" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 763</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ad frigus stupet (vinum), opp. gelascit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 21, 27, § 132</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stupuitque Ixionis orbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignavo stupuerunt verba palato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:6:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 6, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stupente ita seditione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 25</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45666.5" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be astonished</hi> or <hi rend="ital">amazed at</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to wonder at</hi> any thing (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">admiror): pars stupet innuptae donum exitiale Minervae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia dum stupet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:96" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regis delicias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:15:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 15, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum omnia stupeo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 29 al.</bibl></cit>— Hence, <hi rend="ital">part. fut. pass.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">stŭpendus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">wonderful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">astonishing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">amazing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stupendous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtutibus stupendus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:7:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 5, 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtutum stupenda penetralia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Nazar.</author> Pan. Const. 6, § 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
